content.protection: pro to 3 inches; shares same anchor as Eye of the Tiger (Little Black Sambo).
content.location: In-between Eye of the Tiger (Little Black Sambo) and Bonsai Crack. Basically same start as Bonsai Crack, except it veers left.

content.description: Climbs a fun face intersecting a few horizontal cracks. Delicate moves at the top (crux) protected by a bolt.
content.protection: 2 bolts protect the two cruxes, pro to 3 inches.Three 0.5 C4 can be placed in the horizontal cracks.
content.location: Left of the double crack system (This Pussy Eats You), striating from the block.

content.description: Crux is near the anchor.  Hand crack, in the beginning there are several mantles to ledges.
content.protection: Medium Cams/Nuts, 2 bolts, 2 bolt anchor.  Can toprope.

content.description: Fun start with some stemming leads to hand cracks. 5.9 in the guidebook, seemed casual for the grade.

The route is fairly straight forward. Simply ascend the crack (the direct boulder start is rated 5.10b) to where the crack splits into a "Y" shape which creates two parallel cracks (thus the routes' namesake!). Twenty feet above the split, make a short traverse to the left on a small horizontal crack. The two cracks can be stemmed and jammed (5.9) to the top of the climb. Or the left most crack can be jammed (.10a) to make the route more challenging. There are two anchor bolts at the top of the climb. Pro to 2". The upper section requires smaller gear (3/8" to 3/4")
content.protection:
Essential Gear

+ Single 50 meter rope

+ A few slings for directionals

+ Pro to 2" (#1 Metolious TCU and several medium pieces... nuts work well too!)
content.location: When first approaching the Courtright area, locate a gravel pullout on the right side of Courtright Road (next to the PG&E access gate). At the top end of the gravel pullout, locate a small rock cairn that identifies the trail to the Tiger Cage/Tiger Wall area. Follow this trail around the right side of the segmented and terraced rock formation. As the trail bends left, a wall appear on the left. This is Tiger Cage. Continue uphill 100 yards further and locate a single crack, that eventually splits into two parallel cracks twenty feet above the base. This is the start of 'This Pussy Eats You'.

content.description: Climb up to a ledge and traverse left.  Clip a bolt and climb up a small ramp to a crack that you can layback.  Punch it to a stance to place a piece high above your head and place another piece before getting to a horizontal rest.  Clip the bolt above and quickly realize that this is your last piece of protection.  Take stock of your edge climbing skills and keep your heart-rate low as you dance your way fifteen feet to the anchor.  This is not a sport route and should not be taken lightly.  If you fall close to the lip, you could come very close to the ledge below.
content.protection: A few big finger pieces and a .75 camalot.  There are two bolts at the top, but no rap anchor.  You can scramble up to clean or rap off of the anchors on This Pussy Eats You.
content.location: This is to the left of New Jersey Attitude.  There is tiny pine tree in the rock down and to the left of the first bolt.  Locate a bolt about 20 feet up and another bolt right above a horizontal break at about 35 feet.

content.description:
A nice warm up for the area. Start on the slab/arete immediately to the left of Jigsaw. Easy climbing past three bolts leads to a gear section. Bust right through a tiny roof and follow the flake with small gear and one more bolt to the top.

#2 and #3 Camelot cams for the anchor, or traverse to the bolted anchor on Jigsaw
content.protection: 4 bolts, single cams fingers to #3 Camelot.
content.location: In between Bonsai crack and Jigsaw. Starts at the toe of the slab

content.description: Obvious short section of off-width off the deck leads to large ledge and a couple short hand cracks to the top.
content.location: Right of Bonsai Crack. Belay is a short scramble up to starting ledge.

content.description: Interesting and varied climbing. Scramble up and clip the first bolt. Traverse the undercling across the face. Make a somewhat baffling crux move before moving right into the flake. Place some cams and enjoy the jams. Once on top of the flake/pedestal, bust back left onto the technical slab to reach a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Start is to directly left of the offwidth crack

content.description: A short right-facing corner leads to a upward-left trending fingertip crack, to easier slab/face above. Guidebook rates 5.10a, but it's pretty cruiser compared to some of the other 5.9s at Tiger Cage.
content.location: Far left side of Tiger Cage; immediately left of Flintstone Feet 5.8+.

content.description: Climb direct-start slab or come in from the right off a block into diagonal cracks for easier climbing. Gain a small ledge, climb featured face above, then transition into the crux slab near the top. Guidebook rates 5.8+.
content.protection: Bolts, pro to 3". A single bolt only is at the top; you can back it up with gear. For top rope, an alternative to setting a gear anchor is to utilize the 1-bolt "anchor" for this route and the 2-bolt anchor for the route immediately left, functioning as a TR for both routes.
content.location: Second bolted route on the far left side of Tiger Cage, immediately right of Give That Cat a Comb.

content.description: Start up the small right facing crack/corner (5.7 fingers) to the appex of the crack. At the top of the crack, there is a 2" undercling (good pro). Head above this undercling (slightly height dependant) to a small dishy ledge and up a left facing corner. Once in the left facing corner, climb 20 feet and look for a small ledge that traverses to the right out onto the open face. The first bolt is located just at the end of the ledge. Climb past this bolt onto 5.7 slab (nice holes and dimples for features). Reach a second bolt, which protects a few 5.8 slab friction moves. Continue up and slightly left, aiming for a steep overlap. Once at the overlap (3/8 Alien), cross left over onto steeper face climbing (sustained 5.9) and then climb up past a flaring horizontal crack. Above the crack is the third and final bolt, clip the bolt and ascend 6 more feet to the top of the wall to a 2-bolt anchor.
content.protection:
Essential Gear

+ A 60 meter rope (Now reaches the ground easily when lowering from the two bolt anchor)

+ 6 Quickdraws

+ pro to 2" (#1 Camelot and 3/8" Alien works just fine!)
content.location: When first approaching the Courtright area, locate a gravel pullout on the right side of Courtright Road (next to the PG&E access gate). At the top end of the gravel pullout, locate a small rock cairne that identifies the trail to the Tiger Cage/Tiger Wall area. Follow this trail around the right side of segmented and terraced rock formation. As the trail bends left, a wall on the left side appears. This is Tiger Cage. Continue 50 yards further and locate a small right facing crack corner on a smooth polished slab. This crack/corner ascends 25 feet and then arches to the right. This is the start of 'Eye Of The Tiger'

content.description:
The crux is above the second bolt.  This is where you have to crank onto slopers.

FA:  Dwight Kroll, July 1996
content.protection: 2 bolts, pro to 1", 3/8 Alien, or you can toprope.
content.location: Between This Pussy Eats You and Tiger Tiers.

content.description: groove-like cracks that take cams leads to 3 bolts on easy slab/face, leads to large ledge, mantle and 3 more bolts above the ledge (second of the 3 bolts is the crux with micro edges)
content.location: Right of Eye of the Tiger (Little Black Sambo).
